Series III: Officers and Staff Members
Jewish Labor Committee Records, Part III
Jewish Labor Committee Records, Part III

Benjamin Tabachinsky's files provide evidence of the JLC's relationship to other Jewish and labor organizations and offer a comprehensive overview of the JLC's activities in the 1950s through the 1970s.

Benjamin Tabachinsky (1895-1967) was appointed Executive Secretary of the JLC in 1963. Before coming to the U.S. from Poland in 1938, Tabachinsky was a member of the administrative boards of ORT (Obshestvo Remeslenofo zemledelcheskofo Truda; The Society for Trades and Agricultural Labour) and TOZ (Towarzystwo Ochrony Zdrowia Ludności Żydowskiej; Society for Safeguarding the Health of the Jewish Population), Jewish organizations dedicated to promoting education and healthcare, respectively. During the war and its aftermath, he was a member of an American Federation of Labor rescue committee for European labor leaders. Prior to becoming Executive Secretary, Tabachinsky served for many years as the JLC's National Campaign Director.
